ENERGY MANAGEMENT ENGINEER, CO-OP

4 to 8 Months - Victoria

The Opportunity

BC Ferries is seeking a candidate to support the Environmental Sustainability team to deliver the Company's Strategic Energy Management Plan (SEMP). The candidate will lead on a mutually agreed to initiative to demonstrate continuous improvement for a performance measure in the Company's energy management program. The candidate will carry out project proposal, project planning, data collection, data analysis and reporting, and strategic energy management initiatives in partnership with BC Hydro. This position mostly involves office and limited field work at the Company's shipyard, terminals and vessels. The position will be 4-8 months and will be based out of the Atrium in Victoria, BC.

The Role

Contribute to the Company's Strategic Energy Management Plan (SEMP). Tasks include, but are not limited, to the following:
Data analysis
Engineering analysis and review
Energy audits
Promoting energy management awareness within the Company, including written contributions and/or oral presentations
Employee engagement initiatives
Quarterly reporting
Project development and cost benefit analysis for detailed business cases
Contribute to a Company assigned project with a focus on energy management.
Develop and lead the project and complete the required tasks of data collection, analysis and reporting
Project opportunities include the following:
Advance the development of a Standard Operating Procedure for shore side HVAC Purchasing Policy
Shore side asset replacement road map to forward the goal of 'Net Zero' terminal operations
Development of internal data analysis tools for reporting energy metrics
Support the Company's operational groups to conform to energy management best practices.

What you bring to the team

Successful candidate must be a 3rd or 4th year student at one of the BC Universities offering a co-op program

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment while exercising judgment and a high level of professionalism
Strong work ethic and self-starter, able to effectively manage multiple priorities, and adapt to change
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively and in a friendly and professional manner
Must have a valid British Columbia Class 5 driver's license

Join us!

."We connect communities and customers to people and places important in their lives"

At BC Ferries, our employees are our most important assets in delivering our commitment to customer safety, service and satisfaction. We support employment equity and diversity in the workplace and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace.

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
